alert.note: Alert for Broome; Chenango; Tioga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Broome, east central Tioga and southwestern Chenango Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 421 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nanticoke, or near Greater Binghamton Airport, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Maine, Nanticoke, Newark Valley, Whitney Point, Lisle, Greater Binghamton Airport, Chenango Forks, Castle Creek, Chenango Valley State Park and East Berkshire. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 7 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
